website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, budget-priced balance bike that is best used as a starter bike for younger kids.
pros: At only 7.25 pounds, this bike is easy for even younger kids to maneuver
It features a padded handlebar for safety and never-flat foam wheels
The seat and handlebars adjust slightly to provide a more comfortable fit
cons: This bike isn't designed to handle rugged play

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Great deal! Instead of spending $30 for a replacement tire for my son's $100 balance bike, I just bought this brand new bike for $45. The tires are more of a strong foam than a rubber tire. That means less maintenance but probably less traction. Since my 3 & 4 year old kids can only go so fast this had never been an issue. It feels kind of cheap but even if it only lasts a few years that is all I really need it for. Overall it is a very good deal. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: My Son LOVES His Blue Bike
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2 year old son loves his blue bike. We take it around the block several times a week, and he's gone from just sitting on it inside the house at Christmas to "riding" with me pushing him and holding him upright in January to "walking" on it around the house in February to FLYING around the house in March. Now he cruises the sidewalks in the neighborhood, going so fast I have to run to keep up. I wonder if he'll even need training wheels when we switch to a pedal bike...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Luoma

customer_reviews.title: Great for a learning step
customer_reviews.text: My four year old loves his bike. It has been crashed a lot but nothing broke. The foam wheels are starting to wear but a bike like this is not meant for long term use. He picked up using it with no feet after a couple weeks of using it about a half hour a day. Now we will be looking to upgrade him to a pedal bike without training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bike. We gave it to our son for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. We gave it to our son for Christmas when he was 3.5. He figured out the balancing in a few days and loves it. He throws it down a lot when hopping off and the handles have held up really well. I also thought the tires not being real tubes would be a problem, but it's been just the opposite. They have held up well too. He has ridden it now for about 6 months and is fully ready for a bike with peddles. He learned much quicker than our other children that used training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: brown3009

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommending for pre-big kid bike!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my five year old, but my six (almost seven) year old likes to use it too. It’s too small for my older daughter, but it helped her to understand balance so much more quickly then her traditional bike! We had been working with her on her big kid bike all summer with little progress, she spent a week coasting around on this and BAM, she’s riding her big kid bike like a pro!!
customer_reviews.author: Charitykb

customer_reviews.title: INSTRUCTIONS ARE BAD!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic pieces and screws that holds everything are NOT!! like the ones in the picture and video like the instruction said to go. We try to watch the video to follow along but the pieces we had and the pieces the person in video had we’re completely different. Plus the instructions were horrible on the paper!!!! I returned it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and lightweight!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike was way better than I expected for the price!! I bought it for our 4 year old grandson and he loves it!! It is very sturdy and lightweight! Our grandson can even pick it up and carry it! I highly recommend this bike to anyone looking to buy a balance bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Bussen

customer_reviews.title: Okay bike
customer_reviews.text: Good bike. The directions to put them together were not the clearest but it’s doable. I wish the seat was easier to adjust so that both my kids could use it easily. Overall, good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike
customer_reviews.text: I got this balance bike for my 5 years old son so he can learn how to balance himself. Long story short, he knows how to ride his bike within a few days by being on the balance bike. Great price, great balance bike!!!
customer_reviews.author: JVE

customer_reviews.title: Front wheel bearings failed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our 2.5 year old son. Tires lost tread quickly and front wheel bearings failed after maybe a dozen laps around our neighborhood. We will be buying name brand bikes in the future
customer_reviews.author: BigJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2.5 year old first bike
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous because the box arrived completely damaged; tape was ripped, holes in the box, part of the bike popping out. However took our chances, easily assembled the bike, and so happy we kept it as it is PERFECT for my 2.5 year old. Adjustable seat and handle bars will give us years of use. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: LexBear

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and it really works!
customer_reviews.text: It only took about a week or 2 for my 4 year old daughter to get very comfortable at balancing with this. She was not able to learn with a traditional training wheels bike. Now she is able to ride a 2 weel bike with pedals. This was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than the Chicco Red Bullet
customer_reviews.text: Even though the directions do not match the model in the box, the bike is easy to put together. My 3 and almost 5 year old boys both use the bike and love it. They are 38 and 44 inches tall and it works well for both. We like it a lot better than our Chicco Red bullet, which has a front wheel that spins all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old rides like a pro!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I've bought. My 2 year old loved it. It was riding it through the house in no time with his feet up. I only bought another one because all the kids that came to the house wanted to ride it too.
customer_reviews.author: VoitRN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Bday present for my two year old. A month later and he still rides it every day. He has to use his tippy toes and bike is on lowest setting...but it works and he LOVES it. The smiles he gives are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Janalee Perry

customer_reviews.title: Instructions for assembly are terrible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the assembly was very difficult for one person and the video on line does not match the product plus parts in the box not exactly like the printed instructions. It was a nightmare before the kid ever got to sit on it.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Instructions on assembly could be better but eventually I figured it out. Steering wheel doesn’t stay straight so needs frequent straightening. Overall worth the price compared to more expensive options
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bearings fail after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Rear bearings came apart. Had the bikes for 5 months with MAYBE 2 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: ignite

customer_reviews.title: That doesn't stop her from having a lot of fun w/ her bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is almost 2 but she is short for her age so she can't fully touch her feet on the ground even w/ the seat at the lowest level. That doesn't stop her from having a lot of fun w/ her bike. As a parent I liked the fact that it was easy to assemble and light
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo C Lopes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Price
customer_reviews.text: The bike is cheap priced and is built cheap, but so far knock on wood it's done what is suppose to do and my little boy loves it. If I had to I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cox

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve got all my kids a balance bike to start with
customer_reviews.text: Weve had ours for about 3 years and it’s still doing good it’s perfect for places without a lot of concrete no training wheels To make your kid fall over in uneven surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light weight affordable
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves his bike! (He is two) except I really wish it had a brake but a mega deal for the price. Super light weight witch is my favorite part because my son feels like a big boy carrying his own bike everywhere he wants
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: i bought for my friend’s son for his 2nd birthday. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Great balance bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike was easy to assemble. I wish it had real rubber tires but they’re holding up just fine. My son is big for his age and this is a perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: jessica vastola

customer_reviews.title: Nice 1st bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is nice. Granddaughter will love it. Directions are terrible. Had pieces not listed on sheet but figured it out. Go China!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vilano Rally balance bike training
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter love it and saying my first own bicycle
customer_reviews.author: MJWojcik

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome my son is 3 and he’s cruising down the road after only a few weeks of using this!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best bike!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little bike for a small price! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda h

customer_reviews.title: Same as Strider
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a stolen strider. Same quality and cost less then the strider. I love the neon green color. its held up to a 2 year old and 5 year old for a few months now.
customer_reviews.author: Heather H

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great for my son to learn how to balance and helped him move up to a bike with training wheels:)
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Murray

customer_reviews.title: Most of them work fine but one of the pink ones only lasted a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these bikes for my child care center. Most of them work fine but one of the pink ones only lasted a week before the bearings failed in the front tire. So I would say it’s hit or miss on the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dollar store quality, Junk, don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Complete piece of junk. Honestly, the quality of this bike is embarrassing. I'm junk glad my 3 year old won't know the difference. A $10 bike at best.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: You will love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Bike! My 4 year old would ride his tricycle without pedaling, his twin sister would pedal, so we knew that we had to get him a balance bike. The price was affordable, the weight is perfect for his age, easy to lift. We live in an apartment and today we finally went to the park and he just took OFF! He is so happy with the bike. The installation guide could you use some help but not hard to figure out. Overall an awesome bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kenya Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome starter bike I bought each of my kids one. Not only have they learned to ride a bike with peddles at 4. The neighbors kids have learned to ride there bike as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vol4life

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice little bike. I Didn't know it had solid wheels. But works fine my son loves it. Quality is ok. Not great but ok. Handle bars wont stay tight.
customer_reviews.author: Rj B.

customer_reviews.title: ... bought for our kids and they ride it and love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd balance bike we've bought for our kids and they ride it and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Vaughn Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Happy nephew, happy aunt!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old nephew can finally keep up with his big brothers! Perfect size, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter13

customer_reviews.title: But the quality is great, nice coloring
customer_reviews.text: Seems a little taller than other balance bikes.. But the quality is great, nice coloring, easy to put together and my 18m old son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his new bike. It is his 2nd one because he rode his 1st one so much he wore out the back tire.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Kordus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for starters, kids love it. Cam on time ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my 3 1/2 yr old grandson loved it. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son is enjoying learning to balance with this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kline

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but grandson has to grow a little taller!
customer_reviews.text: Seat still a little too high for our 2 year old grand son.
customer_reviews.author: DutchDK

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great balance bike. Only 4 stars due to foam wheels. The tires slide on the tile and hardwood floors. Fine on the concrete or asphalt
customer_reviews.author: Katie Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this bike! Great purchase, easy to put together, excellent price, and fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Shedd

customer_reviews.title: Mind the tires
customer_reviews.text: Was very dissappointed with the wheels.. Was under the impression they were real tires instead of the plastic wheels put on toys.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boyko

customer_reviews.title: We love it! Our grandson loves his new bike
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Our grandson loves his new bike! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Tammie C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome starter
customer_reviews.text: Got this bike for my two year old grandsons birthday, he loved it and was on it pushing it by the end of the day. Its the best bike for him more like a real dirt bike. No messing around with training wheels they never teach a child how to balance and ride. This will make it easier for him when its time to transfer to a dirt bike.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 y.o. son loves his new bike. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike, poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The initial assembly was a little challenging as the directions were poorly written, pictures unclear, and 1 part was not pre-assembled as shown in the directions. Once together, the bike seemed sturdy and worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: pocohantasdenver

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and the bike looks sturdy. He's going to dig it.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk787

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bike has plastic tires, not rubber and parts of the bike were scratched when we took it out of the box. Very lightweight and easy to use, but overall a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Danielle L. O'Heir

customer_reviews.title: So far happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far happy with the purchase, for the price seems a nice value compared to Strider which is more than double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Venkata R. Satti

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a great value and my 20m old son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Forille

customer_reviews.title: Cute Strider
customer_reviews.text: Cute strider for the $. However, the tires on it are plastic, not real rubber tires. So we will have to transfer our son's other bike tires onto this bike for it to be of use for this one. The bike tires are the same as a 12". Bike is also metal framed. We are happy with our purchase, especially since other main stream strider bikes cost around $100 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My 3 years old loves his bike can't stop riding it
customer_reviews.author: Walt55

customer_reviews.title: Bought this bike for my son's birthday.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my son's birthday. The steering wheel bushing was missing so now I can't put the bike together
customer_reviews.author: gina grippo

customer_reviews.title: Easily scratched. Tires are foam
customer_reviews.text: Quality and price are both low. Easily scratched. Tires are foam. A light weight starter bike.
customer_reviews.author: gini

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: It's so light weight that even a 2 year old can carry it. It fits nicely in a trunk of the car so it goes along all the time, adults can walk and he can ride his balance bike. It was super easy to assemble and it has had MILES of running already. Great!!
customer_reviews.author: romy

customer_reviews.title: The Balance Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my youngest granddaughter and she rides it everywhere. She will be riding a pedal bicycle real soon.
customer_reviews.author: Adams

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the German models, had to import a replacement and give this one away.
customer_reviews.author: Ethics Gradient

customer_reviews.title: spend a few more bucks on a better product
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction, but you get what you pay for. Handlebars constantly require realignment
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: bike
customer_reviews.text: Good bike just still to big for my son feet to reach the ground
customer_reviews.author: Yaneli Segura

customer_reviews.title: extremely pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for, as our grandson was visiting from Sweden and it meet his needs perfectly. Now our grand daughter is useing it
customer_reviews.author: Ann Reed

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: had to order the bike seat THREE times ... shoulda came with it time numerous uno !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 we have spent on our grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 2 and 1/2 year old grandson. He loves it. Took him an hour or so to graduate from walking around with a bike between his legs to coasting down hills with his feet off the ground. I think this will make his transition to a pedal bike an absolute breeze because he already has the balance thing down pat.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: For my son, it was hard riding on this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Say Chaleunsouk

customer_reviews.title: The bike is perfect for a 2-4 year old
customer_reviews.text: The bike is perfect for a 2-4 year old. It is exactly as the seller describes. Shipped in 4 days. Bike is sturdy and took less than 10 minutes to assemble. I was completely satisfied with my purchase. There is no kick stand but it's a balance bike and the kick stand would only get in the way for a small child. It's perfect and will provide hours of fun for my grandson. It has strong plastic wheels which appear durable and long lasting. The seat and handle bars are adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Grace

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This was a little tricky to put together, but no major issues. Seems like the quality is a little less than they Strider bikes. We have a Strider and bought this one for my nephew. If I had to by another one, I would spend the extra for a Strider. But - for a less expensive bike that you don't have to worry about getting dirty or being used outside, it's good. Seems sturdy and fairly well made, just some added features of a Strider bike put it a step ahead of this one.
customer_reviews.author: bp

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really bummed about this purchase. The "never flat foam tires" are just actually cheap plastic tires. The rest of the bike seems to be made of equally cheap plastic parts that I'm sure will not last long in my rambunctious three year old's care. We'll see. Overall, I think the description of this product is pretty misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Elise Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Seems a lot smaller than description stated and welded connections ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems a lot smaller than description stated and welded connections are sloppy. Has a very cheap feel to it and printed directions were a joke. I considered returning it but kids outgrow these so quickly I figured if it didn't last long it doesn't matter. Besides, shipping was not refundable and once I paid to ship it back I would have paid out close to half of what I originally paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn L. Bergholt

customer_reviews.title: missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The bike came with out the one training wheel. What a bust!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea but this bike serves as a toy
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea but this bike serves as a toy. The seat hight wasn't specified in the description, but it did say for 3+. My daughter is a tall 3 and a half and the bike, at the highest seat level, is too short for her. Her legs remain too bent at the knee she doesn't get a good push with her feet. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Kovalsky

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter who is 5 is loving this! 2 days in and she is ready to lose her training wheels on her regular bike! Well worth the cost on this item! And my son who is almost 2 is about ready to use this with the adjustable seat, it will be easy to lower.
customer_reviews.author: Minnerfish

product_meta.title: Vilano Rally Balance Bike Training No Pedal Push Bicycle
product_meta.description: Vilano Bikes, we make components, accessories and bicycles to fit all your cycling needs. Built to be reliable and high quality while being affordable.
feature_bullets: Helps children learn to balance for easier transition to pedal bikes
Children gain coordination and develop confidence for pedal bikes
Adjustable seat height and handlebar for best fit
Easy assembly - no pedals, chain or training wheels.
